p: Our study population consisted of TB patients ranging between the age of 2 and 89 years with a median age of 28 years (interquartile range [IQR] 27–44). To further probe the age distribution in the study population, we categorized the TB patients into five different age groups ( Table 1). We detected approximately three-quarters of the TB cases to occur among the “young age” and “early adult” age groups. Further, our findings show that about 1.0% of the TB cases were pediatric cases (< 15 years).
